radiographic_examinations.findings: 4-cm osteolytic lesion in the right frontoparietal skull, a hyperdense epidural fluid collection, and a low-density lesion within the right frontal lobe surrounded by vasogenic edema.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Subsequent CT scan obtained 6 months after surgery showed no recurrence of the disease.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Right frontal lobe lesion involving the scalp and skull, with intracranial extension.
Right lower lobe cavitary lesion with hilar adenopathy.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Serial CT scanning was performed to monitor the status of the lung lesion, which had nearly resolved at 9 months.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Repair of the cranial defect with custom-fabricated implant and no recurrence of contrast-enhancing lesion.
